contact.group: Centre for Ophthalmology and Visual Science

publications.title: Generation of two induced pluripotent stem cell lines from a patient with Stargardt Macular Dystrophy caused by the c.768G > T and c.6079C > T mutations in ABCA4

donor.disease_description: Autosomal recessive Stargardt disease (STGD1) is a form of juvenile macular degeneration caused by mutations in the ABCA4 gene.

genomic_modifications.description: Compound heterozygous mutations in ABCA4 (c.768G > T and c.6079C > T).

genomic_characterisation.summary: Karyotyping occurred at a resolution of 300bphs. Fifteen metaphase spreads were analysed.

ethics.institutional_HREC: Human Research Ethics Office, University of Western Australia
